triplets: Processed meat product made from ground meat, fat, and seasonings in a casing
Cooking, grilling, breakfast, sandwiches, stews, and charcuterie
Meat (pork, beef, chicken, etc.), fat, spices, salt, and natural or synthetic casing
Casing, ground meat mixture, and sometimes added fillers or binders
Typically pinkish-brown when raw; brown when cooked
Charcuterie, breakfast cuisine, barbecues, and global culinary traditions
Butchers, meat processors, food companies, and artisanal producers
Fresh: 2–3 days refrigerated; cured/dried: weeks to months
